law.catch_line: Kentucky Board of Licensure for Private Investigators -- Members -- Appointment -- Vacancies -- Reimbursement -- Meetings -- Removal of members -- Liability insurance.

text.section: The Kentucky Board of Licensure for Private Investigators is hereby created.
All members shall be residents of this state and possess good moral character.
After the initial appointments to the board, all members shall serve a two (2) year term.
Any vacancy occurring on the board shall be filled by the Governor.
No member may serve more than two (2) full consecutive terms.
No member shall continue to serve if the member no longer meets the qualifications required under subsections (2) and (3) of this section.

The three (3) board members who are private investigators and the member at large shall receive the sum of one hundred dollars ($100) per day for each day the board meets. All members shall receive reimbursement for actual and necessary expenses incurred in the performance of their official duties.
The board shall annually elect a chairman, a vice chairman, and a secretary-treasurer from the membership of the board.

The board shall hold at least two (2) meetings annually and additional meetings as the board may deem necessary. Additional meetings may be held upon call of the chairman or upon written request of a quorum. Four (4) members of the board shall constitute a quorum to conduct business.
Upon recommendation of the board, the Governor may remove any member of the board for neglect of duty or malfeasance in office.
The board may purchase professional liability insurance for the board members and agents and staff of the board.

law.history: Amended 2004 Ky. Acts ch. 186, sec. 1, effective April 21, 2004. -- Created 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 269, sec. 3, effective July 15, 2002.
